doc.title: Firar
doc.plot: The newly qualified doctor who leads his thirties suddenly wakes up from an intangible dream. In this weird dream, it is as if all the world were there to see him. The doctor wakes up and can't find himself. He feels himself lost in his body. This indiscernible state brings him in front of the mirror. When he looks at himself in the mirror, he finds himself; but his soul leaves him at the same time. This leaves the doctor in an absolute loneliness. The soul begins a journey through the city like a little child. The doctor goes to work with a boredom that he can't get rid off. This state of mind is not likely to leave him.
